newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: ACC Bank says confident of strong H2 growth.
newsitem.headline: ACC Bank says confident of strong H2 growth.

text.p: Ireland's ACC Bank said on Wednesday that it was confident of strong growth in the second half of 1997.

"We are confident that the Bank will continue to grow strongly ... reflecting the general confidence in the Irish economy, and thus enable us to achieve our year end targets," chief executive John McCloskey said in a results statement.
ACC reported a rise of 12 percent in first half pre-tax profit to 7.47 million Irish pounds.
It said strong growth in lending to commercial and medium-sized enterprises was a particular feature of the first half performance.
ACC said net earnings were up by just under 19 percent at 5.4 million, loans and advances to customers rose by 16.9 percent and customer deposits increased by 19 percent.
